segments.text: I see a woman standing at the sink, drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her expression is so focused, almost serene, as if nothing else exists.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I can’t help but notice the water flowing over the edge of the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It creates a puddle at her feet that grows larger by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not see it?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sound of the water is almost soothing, yet it hints at chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the children are up to something sneaky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s on that precarious stool reaching for cookies, completely unaware of the risk.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl watches eagerly, her hand outstretched in anticipation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a curious scene of domestic life, yet full of unrecognized dangers.
segments.speaker: PAR
